adjective.description: Of a nerve or blood vessel: supplying both muscles and skin; specifically designating a branch of the brachial plexus that supplies the biceps and brachialis muscles of the arm and continues as the lateral cutaneous nerve of the forearm.
Consisting of, relating to, or affecting muscle and skin.

origin: Late 18th century; earliest use found in Encyclopaedia Britannica. From musculo- + cutaneous, after scientific Latin musculo-cutaneus.
